definition: to reissue/(of a disease) to recur/(of a patient) to suffer a relapse
again/once more/re-/second/another/then (after sth, and not until then)/no matter how ... (followed by an adjective or verb, and then (usually) 也[ye3] or 都[dou1] for emphasis)
to send out/to show (one's feeling)/to issue/to develop/to make a bundle of money/classifier for gunshots (rounds)

sentences.chinese: 出院后随访无疼痛再发。

sentences.english: Stroke patients were then followed prospectively to assess recurrent stroke and death.
sentences.chinese: 并前瞻性的随访卒中患者，评估再发卒中和死亡。

sentences.english: The first flood was useless. God doesn't want to start a second one.
sentences.chinese: 第一次大水没有用，上帝不想再发第二次了。

sentences.english: Relapse hematoma was treated via the clearance of homolateral hematoma by craniotomy with bone flap.
sentences.chinese: 再发血肿多采用骨瓣开颅血肿清除的方法。

definition: to send out/to show (one's feeling)/to issue/to develop/to make a bundle of money/classifier for gunshots (rounds)
to fire (a weapon) in rapid succession
to send to multiple recipients/mass mailout/to occur in a clustered fashion
to supply again (sth lost)/to reissue/to pay retroactively
approved for distribution/to provide (wages etc) as usual (e.g. while an employee is on maternity leave)
to reply/to recover/to return (to a previous condition)/Re: in reply to (email)
to arise again/to make a comeback/resurgence
